answers.answer: Never heard of that.  Small stones in the bladder of passing a kidney stone, a bad infection I think, interstitial cystitis and I think cancer as well can cause blood in your urine.   Drinking more water may help, not cure, with an infection and might dilute the urine more, making it more obscure to your eyes, but  please, please, don't just try to treat such a serious thing at home without seeing a doctor about it!

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you are a diabetic then consuming lots of sugars could make you susceptible to kidney and urinary infection and thus blood in urine. Other than that there is no co-relation. The most common cause of blood in urine is UTI. The next possible diagnosis is stone. The stone can be anywhere in the urinary system from kidney to urethra. Cancers of urinary system or some drugs too cause blood in urine. Bladder infections and cysts too can cause similar symptoms. In females vaginal and cervical infections and cancers along with uterine fibroids could be other possibilities. Your urologist will run a couple of tests including urine examination, a CT/ultrasound of abdomen to rule out stones and other causes.Hope this helps. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
One other thing doctornee's list reminded me of- if you are a menstruating female, endometriosis in the bladder can cause blood in the urine.

First and foremost you need a blood test to check to see if you have diabetes.If you are craving sugar, you maybe a diabetic, and not know.I definately would get checked for diabetes, and send the urine of for analysis, and culture.Good luck.Nicola

question: can it be caused by a lot of consumed sugar or sweets make you urinate blood? And if so could you drink water to cure it?
title: Serious Problem?
